intro: Hieracium chondrillifolium subsp. chondrillifolium, commonly known as the chondrillifolium hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy stems. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, and the plant often grows in dry, disturbed soils. It is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of habitats, including meadows and grasslands. This subspecies is distinguished by its specific leaf morphology and floral structure compared to other members of the Hieracium genus.
